etymology.description: 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") + 䰜(鬲) (lè, "cauldron") — rice cooked in a cauldron
etymology.interpretation: The character 粥 represents rice(米) (mǐ) being cooked in a cauldron(䰜) (lè) to make porridge. This makes intuitive sense as the cooking process symbolizes the transformation of rice into a liquid form.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃粥。(我喜歡吃粥。)
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī zhōu。(Wǒ xǐhuān chī zhōu。)

examples.chinese: 早上我通常吃粥。(早上我通常吃粥。)
examples.pinyin: Zǎoshang wǒ tōngcháng chī zhōu。(Zǎoshang wǒ tōngcháng chī zhōu。)
examples.english: I usually eat congee in the morning.
